current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: Making appropriations for the salaries and related expenses of certain Federal employees during a lapse in funding authority for fiscal year 2014, to establish a bicameral working group on deficit reduction and economic growth, and for other purposes.

action-desc.#text: Read the second time and placed on the calendar

short-title.#text: Deficit Reduction and Economic Growth Working Group Act of 2013

text.#text: This title may be cited as the

header.#text: Bicameral working group on deficit reduction and economic growth

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Bicameral Working Group on Deficit Reduction and Economic Growth
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Bicameral Working Group on Deficit Reduction and Economic Growth

text.#text: There is hereby established a bicameral working group to be known as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall recommend to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Bicameral Working Group on Deficit Reduction and Economic Growth

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the

text.#text: The
overall levels of discretionary spending, including for the fiscal year ending on September 30, 2014;
changes in the statutory limit on the public debt; and
reforms in direct spending programs.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be comprised of 20 members to be appointed as follows:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Bicameral Working Group on Deficit Reduction and Economic Growth

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall appoint 10 Members of the House of Representatives, of which one shall be designated as House co-chair and 4 shall be on the recommendation of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: minority leader of the House of Representatives
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: minority leader of the House of Representatives

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall appoint 10 Senators, of which one shall be designated as Senate co-chair and 4 shall be on the recommendation of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: majority leader of the Senate
minority leader of the Senate

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be filled in the same manner as the original designation was made.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Bicameral Working Group on Deficit Reduction and Economic Growth

text.#text: Any vacancy occurring in the membership of the
Each appointment under this subsection shall be made not later than one calendar day after enactment of this Act.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall meet not later than one calendar day after their appointment pursuant to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Bicameral Working Group on Deficit Reduction and Economic Growth

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and shall meet on each calendar day thereafter unless both co-chairs jointly determine that there is good cause to dispense with such meeting.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Worker Pay Fairness Act/s:202/ss:c

text.#text: The members of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may not report any recommendation unless it receives the support of a majority of the members appointed by both the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Bicameral Working Group on Deficit Reduction and Economic Growth

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives
majority leader of the Senate

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall report its recommendations, including any legislative language required to implement those recommendations, to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Bicameral Working Group on Deficit Reduction and Economic Growth

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the
within 3 calendar days after their adoption.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: by the
in accordance with clause 2 of rule XIV.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

text.#text: The report shall be referred in the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Worker Pay Fairness Act/s:202/ss:f/p:1

text.#text: The report shall include any supplemental, minority, or additional views submitted to the co-chairs prior to its transmission pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Bicameral Working Group on Deficit Reduction and Economic Growth
Federal Worker Pay Fairness Act/s:202/ss:f

text.#text: The
The provisions of this section are enacted by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the

, respectively, and as such they shall be considered as part of the rules of each House, respectively, or of that House to which they specifically apply, and such rules shall supercede other rules only to the extent that they are inconsistent therewith; and

text.#text: as an exercise of the rulemaking power of the

with full recognition of the constitutional right of either House to change such rules (so far as relating to such House) at any time, in the same manner, and to the same extent as in the case of any other rule of such House.

header.#text: Deficit Reduction and Economic Growth Working Group Act

continuation-text.#text: That the following sums are hereby appropriated, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, and out of applicable corporate or other revenues, receipts, and funds, for the salaries and related expenses of certain Federal employees for fiscal year 2014, and for other purposes, namely:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall provide to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the Office of Management and Budget

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committees on Appropriations of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report specifying the use of funds made available to the Executive Branch by this joint resolution.
who work during the period beginning October 1, 2013, and ending December 15, 2013, when there is otherwise no funding authority for such salaries and related expenses:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Antideficiency Act
usc/31/1341/etseq

italic.#tail: , That not later than December 20, 2013, the

text.#text: Such amounts as may be necessary for paying salaries and related expenses of Federal employees excepted from the provisions of the

Expenditures made pursuant to this joint resolution shall be charged to the applicable appropriation, fund, or authorization whenever a bill in which such applicable appropriation, fund, or authorization is contained is enacted into law.
It is the sense of Congress that this joint resolution may also be referred to as the

short-title.#text: Excepted Employees’ Pay Continuing Appropriations Resolution, 2014

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives October 8, 2013.
